intro: Cryptocarya megaphylla, commonly known as the broad-leafed cryptocarya, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly found in the coastal regions of New South Wales and Queensland. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, elliptical leaves that are often arranged in whorls around the stem. It produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by dark blue-black berries. Cryptocarya megaphylla is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and adaptability to various soil types.
